replies.author: wyzhang

timeline.bodyText: I don't think we should allow seqId to be null, as that isn't a valid representation of stored preferences. It forces the caller of getSeqId() to handle a null, which shouldn't ever be the case
timeline.author: albertshau

replies.bodyText: Actually seqId could be null when preferences never get set on the entity. Given the fact that seqId > 0, I am using 0 as default value when preferences are not present. This is consistent with current contact that property map is empty when preferences are not set.
replies.author: wyzhang

replies.bodyText: I see. Does this cause any issues if preferences are set and then deleted? If the sequence number gets reset in that scenario, it would mean some of the assumptions in that metadata processor are false.
replies.author: albertshau

replies.bodyText: Deletion just clear the map but still bump up the seqId. So the only case seqId is not there is the entity never had any preferences set on it.
replies.author: wyzhang
